channel.title: Sqealing sound coming from 6x9 speakers
channel.description:
I've just fit my Ford Fiesta Zetec with a new sound system, and occasionally I will hear a squealing, which intensifies with the amount of revs. After searching the web I found it was likely to be my grounding, which I changed and this didn't make a difference.
I am running 2 front door speakers of a headunit, with a 12" 1000W Sub and 2 100W RMS 6x9s running off a 1200W amp. I'm not sure if the problem is a power issue, and was looking for some advice before I go out and get a capacitor.
The squealing will not get louder when I alter the volume, but will increase when the engines revving.
Any ideas?

@moparisthebest wrote:

The grounding wire, or the high to low input?

Either way, glad I could help.

item.title: Sqealing sound coming from 6x9 speakers
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Will give it a go. Thanks dude

Update - Worked perfectly. Thanks very much!!

Read full topic

item.title: Sqealing sound coming from 6x9 speakers
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

It’s because you are using a common ground for all of your components. The only way I fixed this in my truck with a 1200W amp is to run all grounds back to the battery instead of grounding them to the body like you would anything else, it’s a pain in the ass, but it worked.

Also what makes a big difference, for me at least, is if you use the low (rca plugs) or high (speaker wires) inputs in the amp, the high inputs made a lot of noise for me and the low inputs made a lot less.

Good luck.

Read full topic

item.title: Sqealing sound coming from 6x9 speakers
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

Mr.Chris:

Fords are good, reliable cars over here in Europe. Unlike the shitters you get over in the US.

Ok, well the fords are like tin can piece of shits. My family had to rent one before we got our new cars because the olds cars where not drivable, and when you had the stock stereo on 10 which really isn’t that loud, you could hear the metal on the card vibrating and muffled voices from outside at least 5 yards away. When we got our new hondas you couldn’t hear shit when the volume was on the same settings.

But I am glad that you Europeans don’t have fords that have a stain-fucked reputation like they do here.

Read full topic
